top_procedures.description: Insertion of needle and/or catheter into dialysis circuit and balloon dilation of dialysis segment, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Excision of blood clot and/or infusion to dissolve blood clot and balloon dilation of dialysis segment, accessed through the skin, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Insertion of needle and/or catheter into dialysis circuit and insertion of stent in dialysis segment, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Insertion of catheter into chest or arm artery
Balloon dilation of dialysis segment, accessed through the skin, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Balloon dilation of narrowed or blocked vein, accessed through the skin

Excision of blood clot and/or infusion to dissolve blood clot in dialysis circuit and balloon dilation of dialysis segment, , accessed through the skin, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Insertion of needle and/or catheter for dialysis
Balloon dilation of narrowed or blocked upper arm artery, accessed through the skin
Permanent blockage of dialysis circuit, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Occlusion of venous malformations (other than hemorrhage) with radiological supervision and interpretation, roadmapping, and imaging guidance
Balloon dilation of artery, accessed through the skin or by open procedure, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Insertion of needle and/or catheter into dialysis circuit, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Subsequent hospital inpatient care, typically 25 minutes per day
Balloon dilation of first vein, accessed through the skin or by open procedure, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Insertion of intravascular stents in vein, open or accessed through the skin, with radiological supervision and interpretation
Radiological supervision and interpretation of imaging of artery of one arm or leg
Catheter removal of blood clot from dialysis graft, accessed through the skin
Moderate sedation services by physician also performing a procedure, patient 5 years of age or older, first 15 minutes
Dialysis services (2-3 physician visits per month), patient 20 years of age and older
